'Nuevo LeÃ³n' (), officially 'Free and Sovereign State of Nuevo LeÃ³n' (), is one
of the 31 states which, with the Federal District, comprise the 32 Federal
Entities of Mexico. It is divided into 51 municipalities and its capital city is
Monterrey.

It is located in Northeastern Mexico. It is bordered by the states of Tamaulipas
to the north and east, San Luis PotosÃ­ to the south, and Coahuila to the west.
To the north, Nuevo LeÃ³n has a 15 kilometer (9 mi) stretch of the
U.S.âMexico border adjacent to the U.S. state of Texas.

The state was named after the New Kingdom of LeÃ³n, an administrative territory
of the Viceroyalty of New Spain.

Besides its capital, other important cities are Guadalupe, Santa Catarina, San
NicolÃ¡s de los Garza, and San Pedro Garza GarcÃ­a, all of which are part of the
Monterrey Metropolitan area.
